Export meshcode to geometry

Source: R/export_mesh.R
export_meshes.Rd

Convert and export meshcode area to sf.

export_meshes(meshcode)

meshcode_sf(data, mesh_var)

Arguments

meshcode

character. mesh code
data

data.frame
mesh_var

unquoted expressions for meshcode variable.

Examples

export_meshes("4128")

#> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 1 field
#> geometry type:  POLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: 128 ymin: 27.33333 xmax: 129 ymax: 28
#> geographic CRS: WGS 84
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>     meshcode                                                     geometry
#>   <meshcode>                                                <POLYGON [°]>
#> 1       4128 ((128 27.33333, 129 27.33333, 129 28, 128 28, 128 27.33333))
find_neighbor_mesh("37250395") %>%
  export_meshes()

#> Simple feature collection with 9 features and 1 field
#> geometry type:  POLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: 125.425 ymin: 24.73333 xmax: 125.4625 ymax: 24.75833
#> geographic CRS: WGS 84
#> # A tibble: 9 x 2
#>     meshcode                                                            geometry
#>   <meshcode>                                                       <POLYGON [°]>
#> 1   37250384 ((125.425 24.73333, 125.4375 24.73333, 125.4375 24.74167, 125.425 …
#> 2   37250385 ((125.4375 24.73333, 125.45 24.73333, 125.45 24.74167, 125.4375 24…
#> 3   37250386 ((125.45 24.73333, 125.4625 24.73333, 125.4625 24.74167, 125.45 24…
#> 4   37250394 ((125.425 24.74167, 125.4375 24.74167, 125.4375 24.75, 125.425 24.…
#> 5   37250395 ((125.4375 24.74167, 125.45 24.74167, 125.45 24.75, 125.4375 24.75…
#> 6   37250396 ((125.45 24.74167, 125.4625 24.74167, 125.4625 24.75, 125.45 24.75…
#> 7   37251304 ((125.425 24.75, 125.4375 24.75, 125.4375 24.75833, 125.425 24.758…
#> 8   37251305 ((125.4375 24.75, 125.45 24.75, 125.45 24.75833, 125.4375 24.75833…
#> 9   37251306 ((125.45 24.75, 125.4625 24.75, 125.4625 24.75833, 125.45 24.75833…
d <- data.frame(id = seq.int(4),
            meshcode = rmesh(4),
            stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
meshcode_sf(d, meshcode)

#> Simple feature collection with 4 features and 2 fields
#> geometry type:  POLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: 129.9875 ymin: 32.41667 xmax: 140.5625 ymax: 42.91667
#> geographic CRS: WGS 84
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>      id   meshcode                                                      geometry
#>   <int> <meshcode>                                                 <POLYGON [°]>
#> 1     1   60403310 ((140.375 40.25833, 140.3875 40.25833, 140.3875 40.26667, 14…

#> 3     3   48295709 ((129.9875 32.41667, 130 32.41667, 130 32.425, 129.9875 32.4…
